{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3544194,"name":"Sarper Makas","username":"SarperMakas","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/d9b06d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-01T14:36:38.393Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone,

I’m working on a swerve drive robot using SDS Mk4n L2 modules with Kraken X60 motors. I generated the project using Phoenix Tuner X Swerve Generator and successfully deployed the code to the robot.

However, when I tested the robot using the controller, I noticed that the steer motors are not moving at all, while the drive motors appear to be working fine.

Setup Details:

  • Swerve Modules: SDS Mk4n L2
  • Motors: Kraken X60 for both drive and steer
  • Motor Controllers: TalonFX
  • Encoders: CANCoder for steering
  • Code Generation: Phoenix Tuner X - Swerve Generator
  • Robot Controller: RoboRIO 2.0

Troubleshooting Steps Taken:

  • Verified that the CANCoders are returning valid values.
  • Checked CAN IDs and confirmed there are no conflicts.
  • Used Phoenix Tuner X to test individual motor movements:
    • Drive motors respond to manual control.
    • Steer motors do not respond, even when setting a position command.
  • Verified motor inversion settings in the generated constants.

Questions:

  • Has anyone encountered a similar issue with Kraken X60 motors in a swerve setup?
  • Are there any additional configurations needed for steer motors beyond what the Swerve Generator sets?
  • Any suggestions for debugging why the steer motors aren’t responding?

Any help or insights would be greatly appreciated! Thanks in advance.
